intro: Quamoclit hastata, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple petals and a prominent, cone-shaped central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted for moisture retention. Quamoclit hastata is a member of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
